questions.question_text: To control costs, project funding is being released under a waved approach. After passing each milestone, the project receives the next round of funding. Which of the following is hindered by this funding approach?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Crash schedule. A crash schedule involves compressing the schedule for a project as much as possible in order to complete it as quickly as possible. This typically involves adding additional resources or working overtime in order to speed up the project's progress. However, when funding is released under a waved approach, the project may not have access to the necessary resources or funding to implement a crash schedule. This is because the project only receives funding after passing each milestone, so it may not have the resources or funding available to add additional resources or work overtime to speed up the project's progress. Instead, the project may need to proceed at a slower pace, using the resources and funding that are available. This can hinder the project's ability to implement a crash schedule and may impact the project's overall timeline.

questions.question_text: Ann, a project manager, witnesses Joe, a team member raise his voice to another team member. Ann calls Joe into a private office and tells him that he will be removed from the project if this situation occurs again. Which of the following conflict resolution approaches is this an example of?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This is an example of the confronting conflict resolution approach. The project manager is addressing the conflict directly with Joe and letting him know that his behavior is unacceptable and will not be tolerated.

questions.question_text: A project manager launched a survey for future end users of a new product under development. The sponsor received the survey results and realized the needs are different than the features currently being developed. The sponsor decided to cancel the project. Which of the following explains why the sponsor made this decision?

choices.C: The survey was not stated in the project management plan.
choices.B: The cost of the changes would be more than planned.
choices.D: More than half of the project charter should be updated.
choices.A: Constraint reprioritization needed to be carried out.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The cost of the changes would be more than planned. If the needs of the future end users are different than the features that are currently being developed, it may be necessary to make significant changes to the project to meet the end users' needs. If the cost of these changes is more than the project's budget, it may not be feasible to continue with the project. In this case, the sponsor may decide to cancel the project in order to avoid incurring additional costs. Other reasons the sponsor may decide to cancel the project include a change in business priorities or a lack of resources to complete the project.

discussion.content:
The necessary step to record the actual durations of the WBS work packages is to establish and set the baseline. Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

The project baseline includes the planned start and finish dates for all WBS work packages. Once the project is underway, the actual start and finish dates can be recorded and compared against the planned baseline dates to track progress and identify any deviations from the plan. This information is critical to help the project manager make adjustments to the schedule and resource allocations as necessary to keep the project on track.
